s0846: I heard Feng Wangsun say: 'King Qian of Zhao, his mother was a singing girl, favored by King Dao Xiang.
s0847: King Dao Xiang deposed his legitimate son Jia and established Qian.
s0848: Qian had always been without conduct, believed slander, so he executed his good general Li Mu, and employed Guo Kai.'
s0850: Qin had already captured Qian, and Zhao's exiled ministers together established Jia as king. He reigned in Dai for six years, but Qin advanced troops, defeated Jia, and thus extinguished Zhao, making it a commandery.
